data.title: Nadine Gordimer was dedicated to making a change from a young age through her writing. After the Sharpeville massacre and arrest of her...
data.meta_description:
3,656 likes, 11 comments - nobelprize_org on September 28, 2023: "Nadine Gordimer was dedicated to making a change from a young age through her writing.
 
After the Sharpeville massacre and arrest of her best friend, an anti-apartheid activist, Gordimer began an active crusade against apartheid in South Africa.
 
Gordimer's writing focuses on the consequences and evils of racism and apartheid. Some of her books were even banned in her native country of South Africa.
 
By depicting the complicated personal and social relationships, Gordimer puts the face of racism before the readers.

Find out which writer(s) will receive the 2023 Nobel Prize in Literature in just a few days on 5 October. Check out the 2023 announcement dates at the link and our bio.

Who do you think will receive the 2023 literature prize? Let us know in the comments.

#NobelPrize #inspiration #bookstagram".
